text: I won’t quit Facebook, or stop using Google for my non-sensitive searches, and I bought my Faraday bag off Amazon. What I will do is to devote more time and care to fighting for my privacy and working with others who want to do the same.
author: marcambinder

text: I’m in favor of autonomy and personal responsibility (who isn’t ?) and for a sane risk assessment of our private equities in the digital dimension. I’ve applied for comms jobs at FB and Google.  I know the tension within the companies about core values.  But this ... ain’t right.
author: marcambinder

text: I have. And it’s disturbing.
author: marcambinder

text: Echoing @zeynep, who studies this for a living, I teach digital privacy modules.  And I can’t figure out how to disallow Instagram from using my private Facebook messenger conversation content for personalized ads after spending FIVE hours trying to do so.  This.. ain’t right.
author: marcambinder

text: So I spent five hours de-personalizing and de-linking various data sets, carefully reading the Amazon, Facebook and Google privacy policies.  And moments later, I’m hit with an ad that targets me based on the non-public content  of a Facebook messenger conversation.
author: marcambinder

text: This occurred AFTER I spent 5 hours mitigating my digital footprint online by going (meticulously) through the ads and privacy settings and turning off (or so I thought) web / ad tracking, predictive advertising and personalized ads.
author: marcambinder

text: Does Facebook mine the content of private (or personal, which I suppose is different from private) Messenger conversations for ad targeting across its various platforms?   I know that Instagram seems to know my Amazon purchase history at times. But this was a new one for me.
author: marcambinder

text: Last night, in a casual chat with a friend on Facebook’s Messenger platform, I mentioned that my father is an oncologist.   15 minutes later, while checking my Instagram account (a Facebook platform), the first ad shown was for the American Society of Clinical Oncologists.
author: marcambinder

text: In honor of this week,  a gift to myself --  a Faraday bag.
